TaxonIdentification.species_authority: (A. Gray) D. R. Morgan & R. L. Hartman

treatment.description: Leaf blades lanceolate to oblanceolate, mid 20–80 × 6–15 mm, margins entire to irregularly dentate or serrate, faces glabrous or sparsely puberulent, often sparsely stipitate-glandular. Involucres broadly turbinate to hemispheric, 8–15 mm, widths 1–2(–3) times heights. Phyllaries 50–100, 1–2 mm wide (at midpoint), apices long-acuminate, 3–6 mm. Ray florets 30–60. 2n = 8.
treatment.discussion: Variety bigelovii is found in the Rocky Mountains.
